In Julia, Write a function `clean_column` that cleans a column name (`col`) by lowercasing it, stripping any leading or trailing whitespaces, and replacing any spaces and hyphens with an underscore, eg, "My Column" becomes "my_column".

Here is the code snippet in Julia:

```julia
function clean_column(col)
    return lowercase(replace(strip(col), r"[ _-]+", "_"))
end
```

This function works by first converting the column name to all lower case letters using `lowercase()`. This ensures that the column names are consistently in lower case. Then it removes leading and trailing spaces from the string using `strip()`, and replaces any sequences of space, underscore or hyphen with a single underscore using `replace()`.

You can call this function like so:
```julia
column_name = "My Column"
cleaned_name = clean_column(column_name)
println(cleaned_name)  # Outputs: my_column
```
